channel.title: Blogs on Our Embeddeds
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Our Embeddeds

item.title: Armv7m Startup
item.description:
One of the most successful families microcontrollers has been the cortex-m in its various versions (m0, m0+, m3, m4, m7, m33, etc), and one of the reason of these success is the simplest boot process. In this article, we travel around the magic of code writing and see the different implementations across some vendors and propose a vendor-neutral startup schema with many advantages for your projects.

In this series of articles I try to explain the tricks around code compilation, linker scripts and build systems, proposing, additionally, a vendor neutral startup system for your cortex-m project.

item.title: Elf Loader
item.description: Perfect, you’ve created your embedded system, provided it with an external storage system, created a serial terminal to test things out, and then started your journey through routine… testing as if you were sitting on an old 70’s ticker while you listen to “Sheer Heart Attack” by Queen (a plus for the sound without a synth)

item.title: Welcome to our site
item.description: Hello everyone, welcome to the engineering blog “ourEmbedded”.
